title.narrative: Physical Security and Stockpile Management in Chad in Support of Improved National and Regional Security

description.narrative: This project is a continuation of activities conducted under the previous Chad Cooperative Agreement. The goal of this project is to contribute to improved security and stability in Chad and the Sahel through the effective management of state-held weapons and munitions. This goal will be achieved through the delivery of three objectives. MAG will work to reduce the risk of diversion of weapons and ammunition through improved physical security at state-managed storage facilities and destruction of obsolete and unserviceable weapons and ammunition. In 12 months, MAG expects to construct/refurbish 20 armories/weapons storage facilities and 100% of identified small arms ammunition (SAA) and small arms and light weapons (SALW) will be destroyed. MAG will also work to improve the capacity of national security forces to safely handle, manage, and store weapons and ammunition through the delivery of Armory Storekeeping and Management training course to 80 personnel. Lastly, MAG will conduct additional technical assessments of PSSM needs at 20 weapons/ammunition storage facilities to identify and prioritize further PSSM needs.
